I don't know why your headless chromium seems to want X11. But I believe
yo=
u should be able to run regular chromium (or buggy "headless" chromium)
wit=
hout a gpu, by using Xvfb or Xvnc.

Noah


On Mon, Feb 27, 2017 at 1:54 AM,=
 'Markus.Mirsberger'
markus.mirsberger@... [archive-crawler] <archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com>
wrote:

>
>
> Hi Chase,
>
> our problem is probably =
that our server has no gpu at all. Even when I am
> running chromium in hea=
dless mode it throws me the error:
>
> *ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(271)] Gt=
k: cannot open display: 1 *
>
> Do you know if your server has no gpu as we=
ll and if so.... could you
> maybe give me a hint how to setup chromium to =
run in headless mode
> sucessfully?
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
>
>
>
> Am 15.02.2=
017 um 05:02 schrieb 'Dooley, Chase' cdool@...
> [archive-crawler]:
>
>=

>
> Lauren, you=E2=80=99re a lifesaver! That did the trick. And Markus, I =
have it
> setup to run headless chromium right now. I=E2=80=99m just testin=
g this all, but it
> seems to be working.
>
>
>
> *From:* archive-crawler@y=
ahoogroups.com [mailto:archive-crawler@
> yahoogroups.com <archive-crawler@=
yahoogroups.com>]
> *Sent:* Tuesday, February 14, 2017 4:43 PM
> *To:* arch=
ive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> *Subject:* [archive-crawler] Re: Heritrix and=
 Umbra Setup
>
>
>
>
>
> Hi Chase,
>
> The crawler beans look okay, so it c=
ould be that the correct exchange
> and/or queue binding isn't set up in Ra=
bbtMQ. Since your crawler beans are
> setting the `exchange` and `routingKe=
y` properties to non-defaults, did you
> run umbra using the exchange and r=
outing key you defined? If you run umbra
> with flags as "--exchange heritr=
ix --routing-key phantomjs-domain" before
> launching the crawl, it should =
create the needed exchange and queue binding
> for you. Similarly, the defa=
ults of umbra and Heritrix align, so, if you
> don't care about setting tho=
se properties differently, you could leave the
> `exchange` and `routingKey=
` properties out of the crawler beans and start
> umbra with the defaults b=
efore the crawl is launched, and it should create
> the default 'umbra' exc=
hange and  'urls' queue with appropriate binding
> automatically.
>
>
>
> L=
auren Ko
>
> UNT Libraries
> ------------------------------
>
> *From:* arc=
hive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
> on behalf =
of 'Dooley, Chase' cdool@... [archive-crawler] <
> archive-crawler@yaho=
ogroups.com>
> *Sent:* Tuesday, February 14, 2017 7:29:12 AM
> *To:* 'archi=
ve-crawler@yahoogroups.com'
> *Subject:* [archive-crawler] Heritrix and Umb=
ra Setup
>
>
>
>
>
> Hello!
>
> I'm working on setting up Umbra with Heritr=
ix for our in-house crawling
> efforts, and am having some difficulties. Fr=
om the RabbitMQ Web interface,
> I see that connections and channels are be=
ing made; however, nothing is
> passed to the queue. I'm just wondering if =
this is the correct behavior.
>
> Here are the portions of the crawler bean=
s that concern Umbra:
>
> https://gist.github.com/chasehd/b7fc2c27c9f33266c=
1241cedbf69415d
>
> I used Andy Jackson's example (https://gist.github.com/=

> anjackson/ce84c8aa61e6fa439e79) as reference, and so that excerpt is
> f=
ound at the top level of the crawler beans where the other Fetch Chains
> a=
re defined; it's referenced, then, under the fetchProcessors bean.
>
> Than=
ks for your help!
>
> Best,
> Chase
>
>
>
>
> 
>

--001a1147bdd08f5fbe054a1477a2
